div.p: I arrived here safe and sound Yesterday Morning the water only slightly affecting my bowels and a little dry cough at night but this morning I feel all right - There has been but little doing in the office my share being about $75, found three letters from you and one from Charlie with the letters of sisters Martha and Mary, At Memphis I did not see the Holmans as I was in town only about five hours Judge Barnity (who has Genl Ormes place) told me he had written to have me appointed Supervising Spc Agt. as he was obliged by his business to resign. he said he knew that Miller had a very high opinion of me and had no doubt that I would get the office if so I shall return to Memphis I found a letter from Tommy in which he says that he regrets that he has no position for me better than this one. the pay of Super agt is much better than my present so I hope I shall get it

and soon. The weather here is very cool I slept last night with more cover than I required with you. I came down the river with Athearn who is going into business in N Orleans and thinks he will do well he again refused the com of Capt in the Reg army which was offered him write regularly and if the Telegraph is in operation to Boonville let me know so that if I go to Memphis I may notify you of the fact Kiss all for me
Mrs Wm. R Hackley Your aff Husband
